oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Advertisement from Nashville City Directory, 1871
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An advertisement of the Edgefield & Kentucky Railroad, published in the 1871 Nashville City Directory. It states: “Trains run through from Nashville to Henderson. This is the only route for Clarksville. The road is in thorough repair, and is provided with parlor and sleeping cars, M. L. Blanton, Superintendent; B. F. Champe, General Ticket Agent.” The Edgefield & Kentucky Railroad connected Nashville with western Kentucky. It was completed in 1859. Forms part of Nashville City Directory Collection, Metro Archives. 1 digital image.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Edgefield and Kentucky Railroad Company
